body: Can you show more of the traceback? It's recursing, so the same line should appear more than once - show enough that we can see a line twice.

Hi Takluyer,

Ah, I see. It's repeatedly trying and failing to create the history database. If there's an error accessing the database, it moves the file out of the way and tries to create a new one, but in this case that fails again.

To work out what the error is, can you edit `/prj/qct/sysadmin/sw_installs/bhaskar/python/python3.3.2/lib/python3.3/site-packages/ipython-2.0.0_dev-py3.3.egg/IPython/core/history.py`. Find [this line](https://github.com/ipython/ipython/blob/master/IPython/core/history.py#L84) and add a `raise` just above it. Then try running `ipython3` again. You should get a different error: copy it in here again.

Is your home directory on a partition that's full, or using some odd filesystem? What about if you start IPython with `--HistoryManager.hist_file='/tmp/ipyhist.sqlite'`? If that still fails, what about `--HistoryManager.hist_file=':memory:'`?

(Sorry about the long delay in replying - I'm just dredging through older issues.

My home directory is not full but it is a network location (located in another machine). I managed to start IPython with --HistoryManager.hist_file='/tmp/ipyhist.sqlite', what is the best way to permanently fix that?

Ah, that could be it. SQLite has problems with network filesystems. Unfortunately, I don't know of any good easy way to tell what kind of filesystem a directory is on.

You can set the same option in a config file to avoid having to pass it every time. The relevant info on the config system is [here](http://ipython.org/ipython-doc/dev/config/intro.html). You might want to pick somewhere other than /tmp, but if you don't care about history surviving reboots, that's fine.

Thank you very much! I've just set in the configuration file an alternative
path for the history db and it works wonders.

Un saludo,
Alberto

Great. I'm going to close this, because we know about the problems with SQLite on NFS, and we don't have any current plans to address.
